docs.lead_paragraph: It started when a stranger asked for help. A woman walked into Jesus Aguais's office at St. Vincent's Manhattan Hospital in the fall of 1996. She had traveled from Venezuela because her son and daughter-in-law had tested positive for H.I.V., she said, and she had sold everything, including her burial plot, to come to the United States for medicine. The drugs they needed for survival cost $1,000 per month.

headline.main: Delivering Hope By Another Route; H.I.V. Activists Collect Drugs For the Needy Outside the U.S.

docs.lead_paragraph: Talks in Congress over an economic recovery package stalled today after the chief Republican negotiator asked for more sweeping income tax cuts than the Bush administration is seeking. Participants in the talks said the negotiator, Representative Bill Thomas of California, who is chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, sought to persuade Democrats to speed up planned reductions in income tax rates for upper-income brackets as well as for middle-income people.

headline.main: Lawmakers Slip Farther Apart On Economic Recovery Deal

docs.abstract: Talks in Congress over economic recovery package stall after Rep Bill Thomas, Republican chairman of House Ways and Means Committee, asks for more sweeping income tax cuts than Bush administration is seeking; Thomas also continues to press for full repeal of corporate alternative minimum tax; photo (M)
